alert.note: Alert for Bosque; Hill; McLennan (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 05 at 10:45AM CDT until May 05 at 3:15PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Bosque, Hill and McLennan Counties. * WHEN...Until 145 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Waco, Bellmead, Hillsboro, Woodway, Lacy-Lakeview, McGregor, Clifton, West, Whitney, Beverly Hills, Valley Mills, Crawford, Lake Whitney State Park, Northcrest, Gholson, Abbott, Leroy, Ross and Aquilla.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
